summary.para: Specifies attributes for a user-mode scheduling (UMS) scheduler thread. The function uses this structure.
summary.blockquote: [!WARNING] As of Windows 11, user-mode scheduling is not supported. All calls fail with the error ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED.

member.name: UMS_SCHEDULER_STARTUP_INFO.UmsVersion
member.summary: The UMS version for which the application was built. This parameter must be UMS_VERSION.

member.name: UMS_SCHEDULER_STARTUP_INFO.CompletionList
member.summary: A pointer to a UMS completion list to associate with the calling thread.

member.name: UMS_SCHEDULER_STARTUP_INFO.SchedulerProc
member.summary: A pointer to an application-defined UmsSchedulerProc entry point function. The system calls this function when the calling thread has been converted to UMS and is ready to run UMS worker threads. Subsequently, it calls this function when a UMS worker thread running on the calling thread yields or blocks.

member.name: UMS_SCHEDULER_STARTUP_INFO.SchedulerParam
member.summary: An application-defined parameter to pass to the specified UmsSchedulerProc function.
